Detailed Description

Class responsible for creating animals.

This class serves as the abstract factory class in the abstract factory pattern.

Definition at line 124 of file Environment.cpp.

virtual Predator* Environment::createPredator ( const std::string &  type,
const std::string &  name,
const hgeVector &  pos = hgeVector(0, 0) 
) [pure virtual]

Create a new Predator.

This method is implemented by subclasses to support different kinds of predators.

Parameters:
type Specific type of predator to create.
name The name to be given to the Predator.
pos The location at which to place the Predator.
Remarks:
If a Predator named name already exists the previously existing Predator will be returned.

If no predator type named type is handled in the subclass calling this method NULL will be returned.

Implemented in SwampEnvironment, and TestEnvironment.

Predator * Environment::createPredator ( const std::string &  type,
const hgeVector &  pos = hgeVector(0, 0) 
)

Create a new Predator.

Parameters:
type Specific type of predator to create.
pos The location at which to place the Predator.
Remarks:
If no predator type named type is handled in the subclass calling this method NULL will be returned.

This method assumes a default name made of the type plus the current value of the predator counter.

If that name is already in use the already existing predator will be returned.

This method is implemented by subclasses to support different kinds of predators.

pos The location at which to place the Predator.
Remarks:

Implemented in SwampEnvironment, and TestEnvironment.

Prey * Environment::createPrey ( const std::string &  type,
const hgeVector &  pos = hgeVector(0, 0) 
)

Create a new Prey.

Parameters:
type Specific type of Prey to create.
pos The location at which to place the Predator.
Remarks:
If no Prey type named type is handled in the subclass calling this method NULL will be returned.

This method assumes a default name made of the type plus the current value of the prey counter.

If that name is already in use the already existing prey will be returned.

void Environment::loadSimulation ( const std::string &  fileName  )
